title: TSMC 3Q Net Profit Rose 13.5% on Higher Sales
text:
By Saurabh Chaturvedi

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (2330.TW) said its net profit for the third quarter rose 13.5% from a year ago on higher sales.

Net profit was 101.07 billion New Taiwan dollars (US$3.29 billion), compared with NT$89.07 billion a year earlier, the company said Thursday. TSMC supplies chips to technology companies including Apple Inc. and Qualcomm Inc.

Revenue rose 12.6% from a year ago to NT$293.05 billion, it said. In U.S. dollar terms, TSMC said revenue rose 10.7% to US$9.40 billion.

In July, the company provided U.S. dollar revenue guidance of US$9.1 billion to US$9.2 billion for the third quarter, assuming a conversion rate of NT$31.00 per U.S. dollar.

TSMC said it expects revenue of US$10.2 billion to US$10.3 billion in the fourth quarter, assuming a conversion rate of NT$30.60 per U.S. dollar.

Write to Saurabh Chaturvedi at saurabh.chaturvedi@wsj.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 17, 2019 03:03 ET (07:03 GMT)
